product_overview: Web Toolkit is an all-in-one, web-based developer toolkit offering 37+ tools across text/code, media/design, converters, and security categories. It operates fully client-side, ensuring data privacy, and supports multilingual UI with three languages.
core_goals: Provide a comprehensive set of developer tools in a single web platform.
Ensure all data processing is done on the client side to guarantee maximum privacy and security.
Support internationalization with English, Korean, and Japanese languages.
Offer seamless tool workflows via tool pipelines and workspace management.
Maintain high accessibility and responsive design standards.
Enable sharing and collaboration through link sharing and workspaces.
Support robust state management and persistence with URL state, local storage, and IndexedDB.
Deliver reliability with thorough testing and smooth deployment pipeline.
key_features: 37 feature-rich tools including JSON Formatter, JWT Decoder, Image Resizer, QR Generator, OCR Scanner, and AI Explain.
Client-side processing with React, Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Radix UI for accessibility.
Custom hooks for URL state management, tool history, clipboard copy, debouncing, favorites, and recent tools.
Widgets such as Command Menu for global search, Theme Toggle, and Tool Actions Bar for AI, Pipeline, Share, Workspace actions.
Multilingual support via next-intl with translations in English, Korean, and Japanese.
Extensive entity models for tools, cheatsheets, guides, and converters for structured data management.
Programmatic SEO for converters and detailed SEO metadata for tools.
PWA enabled with caching strategies to support offline use of cached tools.
Comprehensive testing strategy including unit tests (Vitest) and E2E tests (Playwright).
user_flow_summary: User visits the Web Toolkit homepage and selects their preferred language (English, Korean, or Japanese).
User navigates to the tools list grouped by categories: Text & Code, Media & Design, Converters, Security.
User selects a tool, e.g., JSON Formatter; the corresponding UI loads dynamically (no SSR) via Next.js App Router.
User inputs data into the tool interface, which updates state via URL parameter compression enabling shareable links.
User performs tool actions like formatting, decoding, or converting with immediate client-side feedback and output display.
User can use ToolActionsBar to invoke AI explanations, send data through Tool Pipeline to another tool, save output to Workspace, or generate shareable links.
User can manage favorite tools, view recent tools, and toggle between dark and light themes.
User can navigate tools efficiently using the global Command Menu (Cmd+K) and explore cheatsheets or guides for additional help.
validation_criteria: All tools must process data solely on client side without server data leaks.
Tools correctly maintain their state via URL compression to enable sharing and history replay.
Internationalization covers UI text and SEO content correctly for English, Korean, and Japanese languages.
Accessibility standards must be met with ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and focus management.
Responsive design confirmed across devices using Tailwind CSS breakpoints.
PWA offline caching strategy successfully serves cached tools and pages when offline.
Unit tests with coverage for all critical tool functions pass consistently on Vitest.
End-to-end user interaction flows complete successfully on Playwright tests.
Deployment on Vercel runs cleanly with environment configuration and site build validations.
New tools added follow documented architecture and coding conventions ensuring maintainability.
